documents.document: RT @orionbooks: Only 1 week to go until the launch of Dr @GilesYeo's #GeneEating, a book that will transform the way you think about diets,â€¦

@EoinMcGee @NewstalkFM @ciarakellydoc @LunchtimeLiveNT I don't think I've heard of a fixed an amount since it would differ across countries. not linear salary increases for low paid related to increase in happiness but that relationship decreases for higher salaries - also pleasure/happiness plateaus - happy first then get used to it
@EoinMcGee @NewstalkFM @ciarakellydoc @LunchtimeLiveNT Research shows that once basic needs are met (food, shelter) there is no relationship between money and happiness

We're hiring. Are you a motivated experienced post doctoral researcher with an interest in brain health & dementia prevention & a background in psychology/neuroscience? Check out the careers page on @tcddublin https://t.co/ZcJmeeDEbg @AdaptCentre #jobs #jobsfairy

This year as part of a project for the Irish Government I visited various Irish community groups who support the Irish diaspora in London including the centre in this article. @lynbw @SVP_Ireland good idea. I like the idea of the vouchers so that people can buy what they want seems less like charity - if that makes sense - the only thing is the sign specifically asks for non-perishable foods!

There is an @SVP_Ireland non-perishable food donation box in the lobby of my gym. I am unsure what to donate. I wish that nobody needed food donations. But sadly they do. Serious question do people prefer to receive:

@ciarakellydoc Every night for the last week I've gone to bed promising myself I'll do Christmas shopping the next day Every day I've stayed home working instead. My work to do list is the shortest it's ever been but my xmas list hasn't budged

A great opportunity for an enthusiastic & experienced research fellow to work on a really exciting brain health/ dementia research project led by yours truly Full details advertised on @tcddublin & @AdaptCentre RT #jobs #jobsfairy https://t.co/zIqRXkTDUu
what a lovely xmas present https://t.co/mcyayLVX2y

@barbarascully My mum not only addressed cards that way but also used to introduce herself as Mrs Patrick O'Reilly - Obviously a sexist tradition but I think my mum liked it because it showed she was a married woman rather than a 'spinster' - another horrific term

@sinead_moriarty Santa is a wonderful time though it can be challenging One year one of mine asked Santa for a snowman and a ghost!. Don't fear them growing up mine are adults & xmas morning is still magical for us as a family - however figuring out presents remains challenging Merry xmas Sinead

@NaiFeely I think it sounds like a fantastic idea Look at the reference guidelines for whatever style your discipline uses. Mine was APA & I remember when I was doing my PhD it had a reference format for 'in conversation with' also chat to your supervisor & consider your examiner

@irishexaminer Do they know how the kids who spend summers here over the years are doing now? I often wonder about a couple of boys we had the pleasure of entertaining about 16 years ago. They stayed with a host family & we would take them a couple of days a week to do fun stuff. Great kids
@philipnolan1 @newsbrandsirl Aw I canâ€™t believe the original never showed up. I really am surprised
@ciarakellydoc Oh no the poor thing.
@HelenORahilly @StokeyCatsnDogs stunning cat
@Hoggie1979 @hrbireland Thank you @hoggie1979 I really hope so. Delighted to hear that your little boy is thriving - I would imagine those 8 days felt very long at the time

@BrianPDownes @BrianHyphen @ciarakellydoc Memory is fundamental to cognitive activity Yes you need 'intelligence' to implement or manipulate the processes/theorems etc but all the intelligence in the world won't get you a pass if you haven't learned or have no knowledge of the processes in the 1st place

@ciarakellydoc Oh thatâ€™s completely ridiculous. Never had that when my kids were at school. What crazy pressure. I suggest you make a donation to a charity online where you purchase vaccines or some such & give a card to say you did this on the recipients behalf include the charity receipt

@ciarakellydoc @alanalda you know the funny thing is that opportunity came about as a consequence of me pushing myself to go to an event where somebody asked me if I could arrange for him to see the Book of Kells - so there ya go.

@RoisinTheGinger @ciarakellydoc love it - it sounds fab too I love teal. I do that all the time I buy something new, love it so much I wear it everywhere and ultimately wear it to death then repeat with next purchase

@4sweetjesus I meant it in the sense of brain switch on & off Social engagement requires considerable complex brain activity which is why it is brilliant for brain health but switching the brain to a relaxed 'off' mode activates the default mode network which supports insight & creativity

@RoisinTheGinger @ciarakellydoc Respect, you already know what you are wearing on xmas day! - That's what I call organised. I've no idea what any of my family are getting for xmas I gotta get over that hurdle before I can think of my xmas day outfit

@ciarakellydoc Yes I'm the same - I always have to give myself that nudge & am usually delighted that I did but this time I think I made the right choice I needed a recharge more than anything - Hope you enjoyed yours the velvet gÃºna looked stunning

@4sweetjesus Indeed we are & being socially engaged is really important but I'd been hugely social to the point of exhaustion in the previous weeks & just needed some time out, to not be 'on' - that's important too. Balance
@4sweetjesus Netflix
@ciarakellydoc I did, is it unforgivable?
@TomRourke @MarianRTE Excellent so Iâ€™m not imagining things
@ciarakellydoc I skipped my Xmas party in favour of the night in.
@ciarakellydoc Stunning

@williamhboney1 I've spent plenty of time on the dark side so that should be a welcome back - I've just had some tortilla's & spicy dip now and a G&T - I'm on a roll now - I need some chocolate after the salty .... see what you've started
@BrennanMarjorie I'm even jealous of me

@BobbleheadMo Thank you for listing me Dominque xxx
@williamhboney1 I just ate a chocolate teddybear from a Lindt Advent Calendar - and it's ALLYOUR FAULT

@williamhboney1 have to stop this conversation my mouth is watering I've been off the sweets and on the gym trail - I'll binge for a couple of days over xmas then back on the straight and narrow - it's soul destroying to know like a sweet is like a spin class
@williamhboney1 ok you can have the one from the second layer I'll have the one from the top layer - that way I won't be disappointed if there's only one layer ðŸ“
@williamhboney1 I love the strawberry, the orange and the toffee - you can have the rest - unless there's a turkish delight I'll have that too
